subtitle: Warning signs
title: Warning signs
content:
Created by BabyCenter

Your body changes in many ways in pregnancy, and it is normal to wonder if you need to worry about any of these changes.

**This is normal** Are you tired one minute, fine the next, feeling nauseous in the mornings, getting indigestion, having to pee more often, is your skin changing? Feeling breathless? Welcome to pregnancy!

**These are warning signs** See a doctor if you have any of these feelings:

 - 	Pain in your belly

 - 	A fever

 - 	Blurred vision and you are seeing spots in front of your eyes

 - 	Fluid leaking from your vagina

 - 	Pain when peeing.

 - 	If you are past 5 months in your pregnancy, and your baby has stopped kicking or is kicking much less

 - 	If you have heavy bleeding or bleeding with pain
